title: Martin Bashir brings Simon Cowell to tears with heartbreaking story on X Factor
text:
Martin Bashir on The X Factor: Celebrity (Picture: Dymond/Thames/Syco/REX)

Martin Bashir leaves the The X Factor: Celebrity judges in tears as he recalls his brother’s tragic death on the show.

The 56-year-old journalist is set to go up against Love Island supergroups and The Chase’s Jenny Ryan on the ITV show, where he performs L-O-V-E by Nat King Cole in the opening audition.

After his performance, Martin opens up about the real reason why he signed up for the show – to honour his late brother Tommy who died aged 29 after a battle with muscular dystrophy.

Speaking on the show, Martin said: ‘The real reason why I’m here is that I’m one of five children, and my precious brother Tommy was born with muscular dystrophy.

Martin Bashir on Celebrity X Factor (Picture: Dymond/Thames/Syco/REX)

‘When you grow up with a child and you fight over toys, and you’re aged four, and he never fights back, then by the time he’s 13 he can’t feed himself, you feel you have no excuse for turning down opportunities.

‘Tommy died in 1991 and every time I faced a challenge I heard him whispering saying, “What excuse do you have? You have no excuse. You’ve never sung but someone’s come to you and said give it a shot,” and that’s my motivation.’

Judges Simon Cowell, Louis Walsh and Nicole Scherzinger look visibly emotional by his story, with the former explaining how his story particularly struck a chord.

Speaking to Martin, Simon said: ‘Look Martin, it’s not always about the best singer.

‘For me, it’s always about the person, the story, and how we related to your story it meant a lot.’
